channel.title: VB keypress event help
channel.description:
how could i make it so that if the user presses the enter key, then the text in textbox1 is submitted to a string variable? [code] Public Class Form1 Public textinp As String Private Sub TextBox1_KeyPress(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs) Handles TextBox1.KeyPress If e.KeyChar.Equals.enter Then TextBox1.Text = textinp End If End Sub[/code]
So that was my ammeter attempt above ^

item.title: VB keypress event help
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

If e.KeyChar Equals Keys.Enter Then e.Handled = True TextBox1.Text = textinp End IfSomething like that.

Read full topic

item.title: VB keypress event help
item.dc:creator: @Stroggah Stroggah
item.description:
@Stroggah wrote:

how could i make it so that if the user presses the enter key, then the text in textbox1 is submitted to a string variable?

Public Class Form1 Public textinp As String Private Sub TextBox1_KeyPress(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs) Handles TextBox1.KeyPress If e.KeyChar.Equals.enter Then TextBox1.Text = textinp End If End Sub

So that was my ammeter attempt above ^
